<b>Data Source:</b>
run_analysis.r script reads data from the UCI HAR data set and transforms the data into a tidy data set as specified in the requirements for the project.  The oritignal source data for the UCI HAR dataset is located here:

https://d396qusza40orc.cloudfront.net/getdata%2Fprojectfiles%2FUCI%20HAR%20Dataset.zip

Attribution for the original UCI HAT dataset goes to:

Human Activity Recognition Using Smartphones Dataset
Version 1.0
==================================================================
Jorge L. Reyes-Ortiz, Davide Anguita, Alessandro Ghio, Luca Oneto.
Smartlab - Non Linear Complex Systems Laboratory

activityrecognition@smartlab.ws
www.smartlab.ws
==================================================================

<b>Transformations performed in run_analysis.r:</b>
The original dataset contains test and training data.  run_analysis.r does the following:
-1.Merges the training and the test sets to create one data set.
-2.Extracts only the measurements on the mean and standard deviation for each measurement.
-3.Uses descriptive activity names from the activities labels file to name the activities in the data set
-4.Appropriately labels the data set with descriptive variable names by removing punctuation from the original names.  This data set is named newDF in run_analysis.r.
-5.From the data set in step 4, creates a second, independent tidy data set with the average of each variable for each activity and each subject.  This data set is named TidyData in run_analysis.r.
